title: Etiquettes of visiting the graveyard - Assim al hakeem
transcript: what are the etiquettes of visiting the graveyard the prophet alaihistalatwa recommended the muslims to visit graveyards and said in the past i prohibited you from visiting the graveyards as of today go and visit it because it reminds you of the hereafter so it is highly recommended for men to visit graveyards and not for women because there is a prohibition and a curse upon the women when they visit graveyards and the etiquettes to visit graveyards start with the intention why are you visiting the graveyard if it is to make dua for yourself and this is a blessed place you want to ask allah for things this is prohibited you visit the grave for two reasons one to remind you of your fate and what you will share with them in a few days few months few years time so this is a good reminder secondly to benefit the deceased with your dua with your prayers so the intention comes first then the dua which the prophet assam used to supplicate and say assalamu alaykum peace be upon you o a place of believers you are the first to precede us and we will follow etc you will find that in hostile muslim fortress of the muslim there are many duas and one has to be respectful in the sense that one must not walk over the graves themselves unless he's he's barefooted so if you had to walk on the graves you have to take your shoes off otherwise there are pathways there are places specific for people to walk over that are not over any grave it is prohibited to sit on graves it is prohibited to pray in the graveyard the offer salat the only prayer that is allowed is to pray funeral prayer for those who had missed it and it is prohibited to give your back to the qibla and face the grave when making dua rather you should face the qibla when making dua for the deceased and if you make the grave between you and the qibla so you would be facing both that would be acceptable in sha allahu azzawajal
